definitions.text: a person who keeps watch over something or someone
the person who plays that position on a football team
examples: the left guard was injured on the play

definitions.text: a device designed to prevent injury or accidents
a posture of defence in boxing or fencing
the person who plays the position of guard on a basketball team
a military unit serving to protect some place or person
a precautionary measure warding off impending danger or damage or injury etc.
examples: he put an ice pack on the injury as a precaution
an insurance policy is a good safeguard

definitions.text: the duty of serving as a sentry
examples: he was on guard that night

definitions.text: (American football) a position on the line of scrimmage
a position on a basketball team

examples: there would be men guarding the horses

definitions.text: watch over or shield from danger or harm; protect
examples: guard my possessions while I'm away

definitions.text: protect against a challenge or attack
examples: Hold that position behind the trees!
Hold the bridge against the enemy's attacks

definitions.text: take precautions in order to avoid some unwanted consequence
examples: guard against becoming too friendly with the staff
